Job Title: Clinical Program Manager

Location: Texas, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
McKesson is an impact-driven, Fortune 10 company that touches virtually every aspect of healthcare. We are known for delivering insights, products, and services that make quality care more accessible and affordable. Here, we focus on the health, happiness, and well-being of you and those we serve – we care. What you do at McKesson matters. We foster a culture where you can grow, make an impact, and are empowered to bring new ideas. Together, we thrive as we shape the future of health for patients, our communities, and our people. If you want to be part of tomorrow’s health today, we want to hear from you.

Company Profile

McKesson Corporation is a global leader in healthcare supply chain management solutions, retail pharmacy, community oncology and specialty care, and healthcare information solutions. McKesson partners with pharmaceutical manufacturers, providers, pharmacies, governments, and other organizations in healthcare to help provide the right medicines, medical products, and healthcare services to the right patients at the right time, safely and cost-effectively.

United by our I2CARE shared principles, our employees work every day to innovate and deliver opportunities that make our customers and partners more successful - all for the better health of patients. McKesson has been named a “Most Admired Company” in the healthcare wholesaler category by FORTUNE, a “Best Place to Work” by the Human Rights Campaign Foundation, and a top military-friendly company by Military Friendly. For more info, visit www.mckesson.com.

We take pride in our culture of connection and believe in a workplace where everyone can be their full, authentic self. We welcome and encourage veterans, individuals with disabilities and others with diverse perspectives to join our growing team. Your unique perspective and experience are valuable assets that can translate into a rewarding career path with us.

Current Need

McKesson is seeking a Clinical Program Manager for our Precision Care Companion (PCC) segment.

The Clinical Program Manager is responsible for overseeing and managing the budget, scope, progress, and team accountability of clinical programs within Innovative Practice Services. This role involves developing project plans and schedules, managing risks and costs, and ensuring adherence to schedule and scope. The Clinical Program Administrator will lead steering committees and meetings with BioPharma clients and oncology practice stakeholders, as well as communicate with all levels of the organization.

This role will also report on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) quarterly, bridge stakeholder interests and clinical areas, and assess and develop end user, business, and service requirements. Experience working with BioPharma and physician practices, as well as knowledge of precision medicine and/or oncology, is preferred.

Key Responsibilities

Takes projects from original concept through final implementation. Develops project plans, budgets, and schedules, incorporating key milestones and deliverables. Defines strategy, goals, and resources. Identifies and minimizes potential obstacles and risks by developing mitigation strategies. Monitors the program from initiation through delivery, interfacing with consortium members, physician practices, and all internal stakeholders.Coordinates and facilitates project meetings and communications.Organize and lead cross-functional teams, ensuring accountability and effective collaboration among team members. Understand and manage stakeholder needs and build commitment to project solutions that deliver target business value across people, process, and technology.Serve as primary point-of-contact for clients.Lead steering committees and organize meetings, facilitating productive discussions and decision-making.Maintain a high level of communication with internal and external stakeholders, including senior leadership; provide clear, tactful, and complete directives, realistic deliverable deadlines, and prompt feedback.Establish tracking metrics to monitor project and team progress toward project goals.Support business development and marketing activities as appropriate.Act as lead resource for dealing with project issues, understand appropriate escalation process and work with the team to make decisions considering the degree of impact on areas involved.Find potential solutions and reach agreement through flexibility and compromise with peers, customer/client, and managers.Assists in the translation of business and clinical requirements into practical solutions with improved efficiencies that can be implemented.Report on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) quarterly, providing insights into project performance and making recommendations for improvement.Utilize knowledge of oncology and precision medicine to inform decision-making and optimize clinical program outcomes.Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and regulatory requirements related to precision medicine, oncology, and clinical program management.


Minimum Requirements & Education

Degree or equivalent and typically requires 10+ years of relevant experience. Less years required if has relevant Master’s or Doctorate qualifications.Degree in pharmacy, nursing, or a licensed advanced practice provider is ideal.MBA or advanced degree is highly preferred.


Critical Skills

5+ years oncology healthcare experience including experience in the provider setting.Ability to set up, plan, manage, report and communicate projects and direct the completion of projects within proper scope, budget and schedule. Strong understanding of clinical processes, precision medicine, and/or oncology.Proven experience in clinical program management or a related role, preferably with experience in provider practice setting and/or BioPharma.Excellent time management, negotiation, critical thinking, decision making, analytical and interpersonal skills.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and address issues promptly.Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex information to diverse stakeholders. Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in work.Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.Familiarity with budget management and financial analysis.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.


Additional Knowledge & Skills

Proficient in using project management tools and software.Proven experience managing many diverse projects and programs related to oncology services that have demonstrated positive results on patient outcomes preferred.Ability to lead and inspire excellence within a team.Results oriented, accountable, motivated, and flexible.Excellent presentation, verbal, and written communication skillsDemonstrated ability to think strategically and successful conflict management strategies.Ability to generate innovative and practical solutions to complex or unusual problems.


Working Conditions

Remote work environment – United States.Travel up to 50% required to client sites, business partners and internal meetings.Must be authorized to work in the US unrestricted – This position is not eligible for sponsorship.


At McKesson, we care about the well-being of the patients and communities we serve, and that starts with caring for our people. That’s why we have a Total Rewards package that includes comprehensive benefits to support physical, mental, and financial well-being. Our Total Rewards offerings serve the different needs of our diverse employee population and ensure they are the healthiest versions of themselves. For more information regarding benefits at McKesson, please click here.

As part of Total Rewards, we are proud to offer a competitive compensation package at McKesson. This is determined by several factors, including performance, experience and skills, equity, regular job market evaluations, and geographical markets. In addition to base pay, other compensation, such as an annual bonus or long-term incentive opportunities may be offered.

Our Base Pay Range for this position

$138,000 - $230,000

McKesson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.Qualified applicants will not be disqualified from consideration for employment based upon criminal history.

McKesson is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including job seekers with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to Disability_Accommodation@McKesson.com. Resumes or CVs submitted to this email box will not be accepted.

Current employees must apply through the internal career site.

Join us at McKesson!

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
